column4: How can I make a table which associates a key of my IBM Thinkpad T42 keyboard and its associated keycode, and this for all the 100+ keys?
xev no good?
xev works. But is tedious.
maybe see documentation for tpb package

I was considering to install tpb before. But some guru discouraged me from doing so.  --  The file /usr/share/hotkey-setup/ibm.hk includes 8 lines " Canonical mapping, commented out." I do not understand them, and so I did not install tpb yet.
your driver is i8x0, you can identify your specific card chip by doing lspci -l

I did identify my soundchip before. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SoundTroubleshooting requires me to determine  the NAME OF my  SOUNDCARD'S DRIVER. Having got this information, my T42 laptop still does not produce sound. Why?
most often hardware mixer is set to silence
you are on alsa right?
apt-get install aumix
then run aumix and see that it loads ok and that relevant channel volume is set properly
The Device is a Intel 82801DB-ICH4 (Alsa Mixer).
yeah, i8x0
I have installed aumix now.
so run it. if it refuses to start, driver/device problem
aumix loads all right. Line and Mic are at 0 level. The rest is not at 0 level.
err!  Line, IGain, Line1, PhoneIn  and Mic are at 0 level. The rest is not at 0 level.
what happens when you press thinkpad volume buttons?
I did operate the additional T42 volume/mute buttons. Now I can play my CD-ROM again. And also Sound Preferences > Sound Events > Sound playback > Autodetect > Test works all right.
so you're set
Thank you very much for your enduring hekp.
*bows*
